intro: Atraphaxis toktogulica, commonly known as the Torkogul sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It has fibrous roots that help it survive in sandy and saline soils. Atraphaxis toktogulica is adapted to extreme drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems.
